alert.note: Alert for Calabasas and Agoura Hills; Central Ventura County Valleys; Eastern San Fernando Valley; Malibu Coast; Southeastern Ventura County Valleys; Ventura County Beaches; Ventura County Inland Coast; Western San Fernando Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued December 07 at 3:35PM PST until December 10 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCHES ISSUED OVER PORTIONS OF SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY... .Moderate to strong north to northeast winds combined with low relative humidities will elevate the risk for extreme fire behavior if a new fire starts. The winds and risk will be focused over Santa Barbara County later Friday and Friday night, then shift to Los Angeles and Ventura Counties on Saturday and Sunday. The decision on whether or not to upgrade these watches to Red Flag Warnings will be made on Friday. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE COASTS AND VALLEYS OF LOS ANGELES AND VENTURA COUNTIES... The National Weather Service in Los Angeles/Oxnard has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Saturday morning through Sunday morning. * WINDS... * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimums 8 to 15 percent common. Very poor overnight recoveries of 12 to 25 percent. * IMPACTS...If fire ignition occurs, conditions may be favorable for extreme fire behavior which would threaten life and property.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are likely to occur in the coming days. Residents near wildland interfaces should prepare now on what to do if a wildfire breaks out. See readyforwildfire.org and wildfirerisk.org for information..
